hero.headline: How to A/B Test on YouTube
hero.subheadline: Test thumbnails and titles systematically. Data over guesswork.

sections.content: Thumbnails and titles determine whether viewers click. A/B testing removes guesswork—let data show what works. YouTube now offers native A/B testing for thumbnails, plus you can test manually. Here's how to optimize through systematic testing.

content.description: Built-in thumbnail A/B testing. Automatic, reliable data.

content.title: Manual Time-Based

sections.title: Testing Best Practices
content: Test one variable at a time
Let tests run long enough for data
Document what you tested and learned
Different videos may have different winners

faq.question: How long should tests run?
faq.answer: Until statistically significant—usually 7-14 days minimum. More impressions = faster results. YouTube shows when data is reliable.

faq.question: What's good CTR improvement?
faq.answer: Even 0.5-1% improvement matters at scale. Focus on consistent improvement over time. Small gains compound.

faq.question: Should I test every video?
faq.answer: No—test high-potential videos, apply learnings broadly. Test older evergreen content for ongoing optimization.

faq.question: Does testing hurt video performance?
faq.answer: No—YouTube optimizes for best performer. Worse thumbnail shown less. Testing generally improves overall performance.
